- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);

- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

2.7.0

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

the problem is with app, not a site

Desktop

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.hktv.android.hktvmall

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter

_No response_

There are constant in-app ads pop-ups.

pull_request.title: Fixes #146615 HKTVmall
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [ ] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [ ] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [ ] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons â€” share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances â€” pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/146615

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

<!-- Please write a comment here -->

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

### Terms

- [ ] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

comment.body:
If a fix requires CSS rule, both rules must be changed to CSS to avoid breakage in conetent blockers
```suggestion
thebaffler.com#$#.boxzilla-word-factory-subscribe-fullprice { overflow: auto !important; padding-right: 0 !important; }
```

pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons â€” share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances â€” pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/146615

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

<!-- Please write a comment here -->

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

pull_request.title: Coalescing rules that work the same.
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons â€” share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances â€” pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

Example: <https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/100000>

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

<!-- Please write a comment here -->

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

### Terms

- [ ] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

issue.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons â€” share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances â€” pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

Example: <https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/100000>

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

<!-- Please write a comment here -->

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

### Terms

- [ ] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

comment.body:
@Alex-302 I can reproduce this issue on my iOS device.
However, during most of time, the anti-adblock script does not appear.

Do you think this as a bug of AdGuard for iOS Pro?

Related rules in List-KR filter:
```adblock
!#if (adguard_app_ios)
@@||pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/js/adsbygoogle.js$domain=meeco.kr
@@||meeco.kr^$generichide
meeco.kr#@#.adsbygoogle
!#endif
!#if (adguard_ext_safari)
@@||pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/js/adsbygoogle.js$domain=meeco.kr
!#endif
meeco.kr#$#.xe_content { opacity: 1 !important; }
meeco.kr#%#//scriptlet('prevent-fetch', 'pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/js/adsbygoogle.js')
meeco.kr#%#//scriptlet('abort-current-inline-script', '$', '.adsbygoogle')
meeco.kr#?#.adsbygoogle:remove()

```

# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons â€” share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances â€” pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/146615

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

<!-- Please write a comment here -->

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons â€” share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances â€” pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

### Enter the issue address

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/146615

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

comment.body:
@Alex-302:

Is this the reason why gorhill removed **AdGuard Tracking Protection filter** from uBO's stock lists?:
https://github.com/gorhill/uBlock/commit/eac8e7ed62983ae970d9ab346a5b394b5c412053

**ameshkov** stated here that you DO support uBlock Origin in AdGuard filters!:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/139081#issuecomment-1380603033
Yet, the filter was never reinstated by gorhill.

After it was removed, I manually added the filter back into uBO.
..but now I'm a bit confused by this whole thing.
If uBO isn't supported in this specific filter anymore, I guess that I actually need to remove it?

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Browser Extension

### AdGuard version

4.1.53

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome, Safari, Microsoft Edge

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://instagram.com

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. AdGuard breaks Instagram scrolling; ad removal makes the page jump back to a previous post and you can't scroll past it. Disabling AdGuard fixes the problem.

2. Can't show with screenshot, see attached screen recording

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7212610/226141501-1651b875-7792-45b4-8641-6dc4408308d1.mp4


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
Canadian French and normal French can have different names for that ad text. 
Regarding selecting issue in filter editor it is likely happening due to Arabic/Hebrew text which write from right to left.

Could you please test this rule in addition for the loop issue (sadly I cannot reproduce at all, but the site is not broken for me). I noticed they check this browser function via event listener on scroll.

`instagram.com#%#AG_defineProperty('document.scrollingElement.scrollTop', {value: 0});`

@AdamWr any other idea regarding looping issue?

comment.body:
Seems it only happens when an ad would be shown (when there are at least three entries from followed accounts are shown as new). On https://www.instagram.com/?variant=past_posts I cannot reproduce while on normal (when three or more elements would be shown). 
When I remove the article to which is jumped again error log from instagram strikes, so likely it seems to store somewhere an ID to jump.

So far with this rule (and other rules disabled via #@) I cannot reproduce the jumping again (and rule is applied and I do not see an ad):
`instagram.com#$?#main > div > section div[style*="flex-direction: column;"] > article:not(:last-child) > div:-abp-has(span:contains(/(Sponsored|Gesponsert|Sponsorlu|Sponsorowane|Ispoonsara godhameera|Geborg|Bersponsor|Ditaja|Disponsori|Giisponsoran|SponzorovÃ¡no|Sponsoreret|Publicidad|May Sponsor|SponsorisÃ©e|OipytyvÃ´va|ÆŠaukar Nayin|Sponzorirano|Uterwa inkunga|Sponsorizzato|Imedhaminiwa|HirdetÃ©s|Misy Mpiantoka|Gesponsord|Sponset|Patrocinado|Patrocinado|Sponsorizat|SponzorovanÃ©|Sponsoroitu|Sponsrat|ÄÆ°á»£c tÃ i trá»£|Î§Î¿ÏÎ·Î³Î¿ÏÎ¼ÎµÎ½Î·|Ð¡Ð¿Ð¾Ð½ÑÐ¾Ñ€Ð¸Ñ€Ð°Ð½Ð¾|Ð¡Ð¿Ð¾Ð½Ð·Ð¾Ñ€Ð¸Ñ€Ð°Ð½Ð¾|Ð˜Ð²ÑÑÐ½ Ñ‚ÑÑ‚Ð³ÑÑÑÐ½|Ð ÐµÐºÐ»Ð°Ð¼Ð°|Ð¡Ð¿Ð¾Ð½Ð·Ð¾Ñ€Ð¸ÑÐ°Ð½Ð¾|×‘×ž×™×ž×•×Ÿ|Ø³Ù¾Ø§Ù†Ø³Ø±Úˆ|Ø¯Ø§Ø±Ø§ÛŒ Ù¾Ø´ØªÛŒØ¨Ø§Ù†ÛŒ Ù…Ø§Ù„ÛŒ|áˆµá–áŠ•áˆ°áˆ­ á‹¨á‰°á‹°áˆ¨áŒˆ|à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤¯à¥‹à¤œà¤¿à¤¤|á‰°á‹°áˆ¨áŒˆ|à¤ª|à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤¯à¥‹à¤œà¤¿à¤¤|à¦¸à§à¦ªà¦¨à¦¸à¦°à§à¦¡|à¨ªà©à¨°à¨¯à©‹à¨œà¨¿à¨¤|àªªà«àª°àª¾àª¯à«‹àªœàª¿àª¤|à¬ªà­à¬°à¬¾à­Ÿà­‹à¬œà¬¿à¬¤|à®šà¯†à®¯à¯à®¯à®ªà¯à®ªà®Ÿà¯à®Ÿ à®šà¯†à®¯à¯à®¯à®ªà¯à®ªà®Ÿà¯à®Ÿ|à°šà±‡à°¯à°¬à°¡à°¿à°¨à°¦à°¿ à°šà±‡à°¯à°¬à°¡à°¿à°¨à°¦à°¿|à²ªà³à²°à²¾à²¯à³‹à²œà²¿à²¸à²²à²¾à²—à²¿à²¦à³†|à´šàµ†à´¯àµâ€Œà´¤à´¤àµ à´šàµ†à´¯àµâ€Œà´¤à´¤àµ|à¶½à¶¯ à¶½à¶¯ à¶½à¶¯|à¸ªà¸™à¸±à¸šà¸ªà¸™à¸¸à¸™ à¸ªà¸™à¸±à¸šà¸ªà¸™à¸¸à¸™ à¸£à¸±à¸š à¸ªà¸™à¸±à¸šà¸ªà¸™à¸¸à¸™ à¸ªà¸™à¸±à¸šà¸ªà¸™à¸¸à¸™|á€€á€¼á€±á€¬á€ºá€„á€¼á€¬ á€€á€¼á€±á€¬á€ºá€„á€¼á€¬|áž§áž”ážáŸ’ážáž˜áŸ’áž— áž§áž”ážáŸ’ážáž˜áŸ’áž— áž§áž”ážáŸ’ážáž˜áŸ’áž—|ê´‘ê³ |è´ŠåŠ©|å†…å®¹ å†…å®¹|è´ŠåŠ©|å‘Š å‘Š|åºƒå‘Š|à´¸àµâ€Œà´ªàµ‹àµºà´¸àµ¼ à´šàµ†à´¯àµâ€Œà´¤à´¤àµ)/)) { remove: true; }`
